attributes.action: Release all information Ralated to the Baker Street Bank Robbery of 1971
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Baker Street robbery was a robbery of the safe deposit boxes of Lloyds Bank at the corner of Baker Street and Marylebone Road, London, on the night of 11 September 1971. The robbers had rented a leather goods shop named Le Sac, two doors down from the bank, and tunnelled a distance of approximately 50 feet (15 m), passing under the intervening Chicken Inn restaurant.[1] To avoid being overheard they only dug during weekends.

The incident was subject to a D Notice at the time.

The Government should now release all information about the incident. ie

1. Who was arrested for the robbery
2. The length of the sentances for those convicted

rejection.details: Please forward your request to foiteam@cabinet-office.x.gsi.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
